skill.name: programmatic-seo
skill.description: When the user wants to create SEO-driven pages at scale using templates and data. Also use when the user mentions "programmatic SEO," "template pages," "pages at scale," "directory pages," "location pages," "[keyword] + [city] pages," "comparison pages," "integration pages," or "building many pages for SEO." For auditing existing SEO issues, see seo-audit.
skill.summary: Build SEO-optimized pages at scale using templates and data for higher search rankings.
skill.author: coreyhaines31

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The backtick patterns (flagged as shell commands) are markdown code formatting for URL examples. Words like 'description' and 'best' flagged as crypto were common English text. SEO terminology like 'assessment' was misidentified as reconnaissance. No executable code or security risks present in this documentation-only skill.

content.value_statement: Building hundreds or thousands of SEO-optimized pages requires a systematic approach. This skill provides frameworks and templates for generating programmatic SEO content that ranks without thin content penalties.
actual_capabilities: Design 12 proven programmatic SEO playbooks (templates, comparisons, locations, etc.)
Identify keyword patterns for scalable page generation
Create data schemas for populating template pages
Structure internal linking for hub-and-spoke authority distribution
Avoid Google penalties with quality standards for scaled content
limitations: Does not generate actual page code or HTML files
Does not access external SEO tools or APIs
Does not perform keyword research or search volume analysis
Does not validate content against live search results

use_cases.title: Local Business Directories
use_cases.description: Build "service in city" pages at scale by combining location data with service offerings. Create hundreds of unique landing pages that target local search intent.

use_cases.title: Product Comparison Hubs
use_cases.description: Generate comparison pages for product pairs using structured data. Scale from dozens to thousands of comparisons as product catalogs grow.

use_cases.title: Resource Libraries
use_cases.description: Create template directories, example galleries, and curated collections organized by category. Scale content without duplicating thin pages.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Programmatic SEO Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me plan a programmatic SEO strategy for [business type] targeting [keyword pattern]. We have [data source] available.
prompt_templates.scenario: Initial strategy discussion with basic context

prompt_templates.title: URL Structure Planning
prompt_templates.prompt: Design URL structures for a programmatic SEO site targeting [page type] pages. I want to use [URL pattern preference].

prompt_templates.title: Template Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a template outline for [page pattern] pages. Each page should include [required sections] with unique value per page.

prompt_templates.title: Quality Framework
prompt_templates.prompt: Define quality standards to prevent thin content penalties when generating [number] programmatic pages about [topic].

output_examples.input: I want to build pages for 'best [category] tools' searches
output_examples.output:
**Playbook: Curation**

**URL Structure**: `/best/[category]/`

**Value Requirements**:
- Genuine evaluation criteria
- Real testing or expertise
- Regular updates with visible dates
- Honest, balanced analysis

**Data Schema**:
- Category overview
- Top tools with ratings
- Comparison criteria
- Use case recommendations

output_examples.input: Create a template for 'software in city' pages
output_examples.output:
**Page Template**:

H1: [Software] in [City]: [Year] Guide

Sections:
1. Why [City] for [Software] - local market context
2. Top [Software] Providers in [City] - local vendors
3. Pricing for [Software] in [City] - local rates
4. FAQs about [Software] in [City] - city-specific questions

**Unique Value per Page**: Include local regulations, city-specific pricing data, nearby cities section.

best_practices: Each page must provide unique value beyond variable substitution
Use proprietary or product-derived data for defensible content
Implement proper internal linking between programmatic pages
Test high-value patterns before scaling to lower-volume keywords
anti_patterns: Creating pages with just city or product names swapped in identical content
Generating pages for keyword patterns with no verified search demand
Ignoring crawl budget by creating infinite crawl traps or orphan pages
Using subdomains instead of subfolders, losing domain authority

faq.question: What is programmatic SEO?
faq.answer: Programmatic SEO is the practice of creating many SEO-optimized pages automatically using templates and data. Instead of writing each page by hand, you build templates that generate unique pages for each keyword combination.

faq.question: How many pages should I create?
faq.answer: Start with high-volume patterns you can validate. Focus on quality over quantity. Better to have 100 valuable pages than 10,000 thin ones that risk penalties.

faq.question: How do I avoid thin content penalties?
faq.answer: Every page must provide unique value. Include original data, local insights, user-generated content, or proprietary analysis. Never just swap variables in identical templates.

faq.question: What URL structure is best?
faq.answer: Use subfolders (yoursite.com/templates/) not subdomains (templates.yoursite.com). Subfolders pass authority to your main domain. Keep URLs short, descriptive, and keyword-rich.

faq.question: How do I choose which playbooks to use?
faq.answer: Match playbooks to your assets. Use Integrations if you have product connections. Use Locations if you serve local markets. Use Templates if you offer downloadable tools. Combine playbooks for compound opportunities.

faq.question: Do I need to index all programmatic pages?
faq.answer: No. Index high-value, high-demand patterns first. Noindex very thin variations or low-search pages. Manage your crawl budget by prioritizing valuable pages.
